isSuccessful.description: Indicator if the request has been successfully processed.

message.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

propertyIdentificationCodes.description:
Property Identification Code - the property code to identify the source of the wool.
This field is not used in New Zealand transmission.
For TRV only

showBaleIndicator.description: Property for Greasy/Processed bale detail, not necessary for other types of bale details.

baleRenumber.description: Property for Renumber BaleDetail, not necessary for other types of bale details.

unitNumber.description: Property for Tripacks BaleDetail, not necessary for other types of bale details.

Renumbers: Bale Details - Renumbers
GreasyOrProcessed: Bale Details - GreasyOrProcessed
Tripacks: Bale Details - Tripacks

B: Bulk Class
C: Colour

F: Premium Test

CountermarkHeadmarkFlag.description:
1: Countermark is to be applied on the bale
2: Headmark is to be applied on the bale

CountryCode.description:
A code for the country in which the transmission was created. Country Code using ISO 3166-1 standard
AU: Australia
NZ: New Zealand
FR: France
ZA: South Africa

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). 
When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".      
e.g. For 400 Bad Request, the "type" value can be "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc9110#section-15.5.1"

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization(e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see[RFC7231], Section 3.4).
e.g. "One or more validation errors occurred."

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. e.g. 400, 403, etc.

errors.description: Dictionary of errors in <PropertyName, ErrorDetails[]> format. e.g. errors: { "name": ["Product name is required"], "category": ["Category name cannot be longer than 20 characters."]  }

CustomProblemDetails.description: A machine-readable format for specifying errors in HTTP API responses based on https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807.

applyRenumbers.description:
Boolean value to indicate wethear to apply renumbers on bales
True for apply renumbers, False for not apply renumbers

applyGrossWeights.description:
Boolean value to indicate wethear to apply renumbers on bales
True for apply renumbers, False for not apply renumbers

applyNetWeights.description:
Boolean value to indicate wethear to apply renumbers on bales
True for apply renumbers, False for not apply renumbers

DeliveryOrderType.description:
L: Local Delivery Order
O: Export/Overseas Del.Order

isSuccessful.description: Indicator if the request has been successfully processed.

message.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

DeliveryOrdersAndShippingInstructionsApi.description: A standard API response object used for all successful API responses

PackMaterial.description:
Where a line/lot contains a Pack with a lower Material, the lower Material shall apply.The hierarchy from highest to lowest is N, E, J, K. Printed catalogue condition: The code for Nylon packs shall not be printed (but shall be transmitted).
N: Nylon Packs (complete lots only)
E: Experimental Packs
J: Jute packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and/or HDPE 1 and Jute packs)
K: HDPE1 packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and HDPE 1 packs)

PackType.description:
A code used to indicate how the wool has been baled. The most common type is Farm bales. Original - the pack type when the wool was originally baled. Preferred - The pack type which the buyer would prefer to be used when his wool is dumped.
0: Standard (farm) bale
1: Bag/butt
2: Lightweight bale
3: Jumbo bale
4: Single bales (normal density dumped)
5: Single bales (high density dumped)
6: Single bales (super high density dumped)
7: 3 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
8: 2 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
9: U bales
A: 4 or 6 bale unitised (normal density dumped)
B: 4 or 6 bale unitised (high density dumped)
C: 4 or 6 bale unitised (super high density dumped)
D: Two Bale Module (2BM)
E: J9 size bale used for scoured wool
F: J12 size bale used for scoured wool
Z: Mixed (to be used with groups only, that is, record type 12)

saleDateRequested.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 2024-03-21

startDateTimeStatusRequest.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04Z

endDateTimeStatusRequest.description: Date and Time with offset value in ISO 8601 standard UTC format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04Z

recordTypesToBeExcluded.description: Record types and record sub-types to be excluded. e.g. 20 - Lot Header, 22A - Group Header

RequestTypeForData.description:
1: Private Data Request
3: Data Re-Request
4: Broadcast Data Request

WoolState.description:
The state of the wool itemised in the invoice.
1. Greasy
2. Dead
3. Slipe
4. Scoured
5. Carbonised
6. Wool tops
7. Wool noils
8. Carded sliver
9. Other processed wool
A. Alpaca
C. Cashmere
M. Mohair

WoolTypeGroup.description:
A code to indicate which section of the sale that lot belongs.
MFLC: Merino fleece types
MSKT: Merino fleece types
XBFS: Merino fleece types
ODDS: Merino fleece types

Bearer.description: JWT Access Token that is added in the Authorization header of the HTTP request. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}". The JWT serves as a credential that proves the identity of the client to the server.
Bearer.name: Authorization

oauth2.description: Authentication for client applications by providing Client ID and Client Secret for an JWT Access Token.
